page.title: 12GUNARD COASTAL FOOTPATH.
page.content: There is a path which runs right round the Island, it is called the coastal footpath.In this area it runs from the Woodvale,up the hill to Solent View Road,along the marsh and then follows the cliff path for about two miles, turning inland to Pilgrims park at Thorness.Round the Island there are lots of wild flowers on the cliff path,the{Dog Rose,}the{Common Purple {Orchid}and{Clover}were some of the ones we saw most.On the sign post near the marsh it said 1 mile to Thorness 3 miles to Porchfield.As well as the big flowers there were smaller flowers, {Stitchwort,Rock Roses}and{Vetch.}We picked some of them to press.Bits of the path couldn't go right by the sea because of private land.In some places because the path was breaking up so much, we had to hang onto the wire fence to stop us from slipping.
